# Research practices:

<div style="margin-top: -20px;"></div>

## Reproducibility:
<div style="margin-top: -40px;"></div>

Can other scientists re-analyze your data to get the same result?
<div style="margin-top: 88px;"></div>


## Repeatability:
<div style="margin-top: -40px;"></div>

Can other scientists replicate your same experiment to get a consistent result?
<div style="margin-top: 61px;"></div>


## Generalizability:
<div style="margin-top: -40px;"></div>

Do other studies exploring the same research question come to the consistent conclusions?

## What are some other reasons why we might need Reproducibility, Repeatability, & Generalizability?

???

Slides with this format are used to facilitate discussion or activities (i.e., action/interactivity in the class)

---

<div style="margin-top: -30px;"></div>

### Why we need reproducible & generalizable research practices

#### Reproducible research creates trusted scientific contributions

> &gt;85% of ecology & evolution articles are *not* reproducible (*e.g.*, no code)

<div style="text-align: right; margin-top: -25px;">
  <a href="https://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0300333">
    (Kambouris <i>et al.,</i> 2024)
  </a>
  </div>

> Articles that make their data & code available tend to be cited more

<div style="text-align: right; margin-top: -25px;">
  <a href="https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/ece3.70030">
    (Maitner <i>et al.,</i> 2024)
  </a>
</div>


#### Nature can be more complex than we imagined

> *e.g.*, animal behavioral responses depend on their housing & handling

<div style="text-align: right; margin-top: -25px;">
  <a href="https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/behavioral-neuroscience/articles/10.3389/fnbeh.2022.835444/full">
    (Nigri <i>et al.,</i> 2022)
  </a> 
</div>

#### Mistakes in research can have social & economic impacts

> *e.g.*, impoverished environment of mice in preclinical studies may explain why most new drug candidates do not work as expected in clinical trials.

<div style="text-align: right; margin-top: -25px;">
  <a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/s41380-022-01913-z">
    (Shemesh & Chen 2023)
  </a> 
</div>

#### Bad faith actors can diminish our trust in science
<div style="text-align: right; margin-top: -33px;">
  <a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-022-02156-2">
    (Kozlov 2022;
  </a> 
  <a href="https://laskowskilab.faculty.ucdavis.edu/2020/01/29/retractions/">
    data forensics details)
  </a>
</div>

#### Consistent methods for globally coordinated research efforts
<div style="text-align: right; margin-top: -25px;">
  <a href="https://www.thelancet.com/journals/langlo/article/PIIS2214-109X(20)30542-8/fulltext">
    <i>e.g.,</i> in combating disease (Park <i>et al.,</i> 2021)
  </a> 
  <a href="https://besjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/2041-210X.13331">
    or climate change (Halbritter <i>et al.,</i> 2019)
  </a>
</div>
